metadata.name: Pragmatics & Context
metadata.description: Context-dependent meaning, usage, register, and pragmatic change.

entries.definition: Study of how context, speaker intention, and situational factors influence interpretation
Situational, social, and linguistic factors surrounding an utterance that affect meaning
Patterns and norms of how speakers actually employ words and expressions in communication
Context-driven change in language meaning over time
Variation in language style depending on context, formality, or audience
Inappropriate alignment between expected and actual register
Using language to describe or analyze language itself
An utterance that performs an action (e.g., asserting, questioning, promising) rather than simply describing a state of affairs
Meaning inferred from context and conversational maxims that is not explicitly stated
Words or phrases (like 'here', 'you', 'now') whose meaning depends on the context of the utterance
